timeline.bodyText: The class seems identical to the upstream version. Can you please point out the difference?
timeline.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText: It uses our custom ContainerAdapter, that's the only change
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText:
It's not obvious to me what's wrong with the upstream version.
Also, keep in mind that this implementation will result in the port being applied to all containers of all deployments (including init containers, sidecars or any other kind of container generated, or found under /src/main/kubernetes).
timeline.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText:
The upstream version doesn't apply the port because the object contains no metadata.
I am pretty certain that this decorator doesn't apply to all containers and if I am not mistaken, my test verifies that
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText: Ok, I now see why you needed to copy the sidecar decorator...
timeline.author: iocanel

timeline.bodyText: We will have to apply that upstream as well
timeline.author: iocanel

replies.bodyText: Yes of course. I just wanted to get these changes in Quarkus so we can include the fixes in 1.6 which is right around the corner.
replies.author: geoand

timeline.bodyText: What happens if the container you add has a port named after the port you are trying to add?

replies.bodyText: That probably won't go down well, but I think it's rather unlikely to happen, no?
